data.headline: Experienced DevOps Engineer Transitioning from Software Development
data.summary: Seasoned software developer with a strong background in web application development, transitioning into the exciting world of DevOps. Proficient in various programming languages, cloud technologies, and automation tools, I'm driven to streamline and optimize software delivery processes. With a keen eye for detail and a passion for problem-solving, I'm eager to apply my skills and experience to drive innovative DevOps solutions.

experience.title: Software Developer
bullets: Developed and maintained complex web applications using React, Node.js, and PostgreSQL
Collaborated with cross-functional teams to design and implement new features
Participated in code reviews and pair programming sessions to ensure code quality
Automated deployment and testing processes using Jenkins and Docker

experience.title: DevOps Engineer
bullets: Implemented and maintained containerized application environments using Docker and Kubernetes
Automated infrastructure provisioning and deployment using Terraform and Ansible
Collaborated with developers to optimize CI/CD pipelines and reduce deployment times
Monitored and troubleshot production systems, ensuring high availability and performance

projects.name: Microservices Platform
projects.description: Designed and implemented a scalable microservices platform using Docker, Kubernetes, and various cloud services

projects.name: CI/CD Pipeline Optimization
projects.description: Improved the CI/CD pipeline for a large-scale web application, reducing deployment time by 50%

data.photo_prompt: Professional LinkedIn-style headshot. Emilia Sánchez, a mid-career DevOps engineer with a background in software development, wearing a blue button-up shirt and looking directly at the camera with a friendly expression.
